main event: On 2nd August 1952 in Atlanta, Georgia, multiple reports came in of round objects, red, orange, and yellow in color, seen over the area. These objects were observed to be moving slowly, changing colors, and making no sound.
interesting points: Multiple witnesses reported observing the objects, including an aircraft mechanic at the Atlanta Municipal AP.
The objects were estimated to be about two miles from the observers, with the white light being very bright and about two or three times larger than the red light.
Radar systems picked up two objects flying at loose formation, with a confirmed distance of 7250 feet apart.

Several other sightings were recorded in locations such as Manassas, Virginia, Washington D.C., Lima, Peru, and Tokyo, Japan, where the evaluation of the sightings varied from insufficient data to unidentified.
One report describes a peculiar bluish color and the observed object slowly fading, then reappearing as red and gradually turning into the bluish color again.
sighted object: round objects, red, orange, and yellow in color
witnesses: civilian woman, aircraft mechanic, air traffic tower personnel
